Dear Kris,

Thank you so much for your instant reply! Now I understand why I have
spent a few hours on the Heritrix user manual, but still fail in
finding that function.

We have been using GNU Wget which has the link-changing function, but
Wget always got trapped by those CGI redirection link! That's why we
need to make a change.

I will definitely check out the HTTrack and hope it will work!

Once again, thank you so much for your valuable information!

regards,
Alan
May 11

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Kristinn Sigurdsson"
<kris@a...> wrote:
> Heritrix is based on the notion of accurately capturing websites (i.e.
> without any modifications of downloaded content). The functionality
you are
> asking for has not been included. It would probably be possible to
write a
> processor for this, however I don't know of anyone working on that.
>  
> Might I suggest that you try HTTrack (http://www.httrack.com/)
instead of
> Heritrix. Unlike Heritrix, HTTrack is designed for mirroring
websites, which
> includes rewriting those links. I think it might be more suitable to
your
> purposes.
>  
> - Kris
